about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

about.name: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving:

hasPart.assesses: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving: | When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

suggestedAnswer.text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.

comment.text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.
At the legal speed limit.

suggestedAnswer.text: More slowly than the freeway traffic.

comment.text: More slowly than the freeway traffic.

acceptedAnswer.text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.

comment.text: At or near the speed of the freeway traffic.

answerExplanation.text: You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

comment.text: When merging onto the freeway, you should be driving: | You should enter a freeway at or near the speed of traffic, unless the speed of traffic exceeds the legal speed limit.

hasPart.name: You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by:

about.name: You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by:

hasPart.assesses: You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by: | You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights. Do this by driving to the right edge of the road and stopping, taking care not to stop in an intersection. You may move again after the emergency vehicle has passed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.

comment.text: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.

suggestedAnswer.text: Moving into the right lane and driving slowly until it has passed.

comment.text: Moving into the right lane and driving slowly until it has passed.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stopping immediately, even if you are within an intersection.

comment.text: Stopping immediately, even if you are within an intersection.

acceptedAnswer.text: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.

comment.text: Driving as closely to the right edge of the road as possible and stopping.

answerExplanation.text: You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights. Do this by driving to the right edge of the road and stopping, taking care not to stop in an intersection. You may move again after the emergency vehicle has passed.

comment.text: You must yield the right-of-way to an emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights by: | You must yield the right-of-way to any emergency vehicle that is using its siren and flashing lights. Do this by driving to the right edge of the road and stopping, taking care not to stop in an intersection. You may move again after the emergency vehicle has passed.

hasPart.name: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the:

about.name: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the:

hasPart.assesses: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the: | To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

comment.text: One-second rule.
Two-second rule.
Three-second rule.
Three-second rule.

answerExplanation.text: Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

comment.text: To prevent tailgating, drivers should follow the: | Most rear-end collisions are caused by tailgating. To avoid tailgating, use the “Three-Second Rule.” When the vehicle ahead of you passes a certain point, such as a sign, count “one-thousand-one, one-thousand-two, one-thousand-three.” If you pass the same point before you finish counting, you are following too closely.

hasPart.name: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:

about.name: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:

hasPart.assesses: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because: | You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Large vehicles require longer distances to stop and accelerate than smaller vehicles do. Making a sudden stop in front of a large vehicle is dangerous because the other driver may not be able to stop in time to avoid a collision.

suggestedAnswer.text: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.

comment.text: Small vehicle drivers cannot adequately see large trucks and buses in their rearview mirrors.

suggestedAnswer.text: Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.

comment.text: Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.

suggestedAnswer.text: Large trucks and buses travel at a higher speeds than small vehicles.

comment.text: Large trucks and buses travel at a higher speeds than small vehicles.

acceptedAnswer.text: Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.

comment.text: Large trucks and buses, due to their size and weight, require longer distances to stop than smaller passenger vehicles.

answerExplanation.text: Large vehicles require longer distances to stop and accelerate than smaller vehicles do. Making a sudden stop in front of a large vehicle is dangerous because the other driver may not be able to stop in time to avoid a collision.

comment.text: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because: | Large vehicles require longer distances to stop and accelerate than smaller vehicles do. Making a sudden stop in front of a large vehicle is dangerous because the other driver may not be able to stop in time to avoid a collision.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: You should not make sudden stops in front of large trucks and buses because:

hasPart.name: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign.

about.name: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign.

hasPart.assesses: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign. | This is the shape and color of a ____ sign. -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Downward-facing triangular signs mean drivers must yield. When approaching a yield sign, slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary. If you must stop, do so at a marked stop line, if it exists.

comment.text: Stop
Wrong way
Yield
Yield

answerExplanation.text: Downward-facing triangular signs mean drivers must yield. When approaching a yield sign, slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary. If you must stop, do so at a marked stop line, if it exists.

comment.text: This is the shape and color of a ____ sign. | Downward-facing triangular signs mean drivers must yield. When approaching a yield sign, slow down to a speed that is reasonable for existing conditions and stop if necessary. If you must stop, do so at a marked stop line, if it exists.

hasPart.name: This sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This sign means: | This sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

comment.text: No U-turn.
No turning.
No left turn.
No U-turn.

answerExplanation.text: This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.

comment.text: This sign means: | This sign indicates that you may not make a U-turn. You cannot turn around to go in the opposite direction at an intersection where this sign is posted.
